qas.question: The concept of matter has not changed for what reason?
Who believes that property can be considered non-material?
Who believes that property can be considered material if one defines it does not have property?
What has definite content independent of the particular theory of matter?

context: The concept of matter has changed in response to <b0_0>new scientific discoveries<b0_0/>. Thus <b3_0>materialism<b3_0/> has no definite content independent of the particular theory of matter on which it is based. According to <b1_0><b2_0>Noam Chomsky<b2_0/><b1_0/>, any property can be considered material, if one defines matter such that it has that property.
